name: 陳雅玫
objective: The course introduces the major approaches in translation theory and lays emphasis on their application to English-Chinese translation practice. Students will be provided with a comprehensive overview of the discipline of translation studies, raising their awareness of both the diversity of possible approaches to translation and the relationships between these approaches. Through the translation and commentary essays submitted for this course, the students will learn to think critically about and be more conscious of their own translation practice.
schedule:
Week 1   course introduction
Week 2　　(1) overview of the discipline of translation studies
         (2) areas in translation research
Week 3   linguistically oriented theories (1)
Week 4   linguistically oriented theories (2)
Week 5   functionalist approaches (1)
Week 6   functionalist approaches (2)
Week 7   discourse and register analysis
Week 8   discourse and register analysis
Week 9   meeting with the instructor on term paper topics
Week 10  polysystem theory
Week 11  descriptive translation studies
Week 12  culture studies : translation as rewriting
Week 13  culture studies : gender & postcolonial approaches
Week 14  Chinese translation theories
Week 15  Chinese translation theories
Week 16  new directions from the new media
Week 17  paper presentation
Week 18  term paper due
scorePolicy:
(1) attendance & participation: 15%
(2) oral presentation: 20%
(3) translation + commentary essays: 30%
(4) term paper (including paper presentation and final written
paper): 35%
